channel.title: projects on Getting Started Guides
channel.description: Recent content in projects on Getting Started Guides

item.title: Concepts of Web Development
item.description: A website is rendered in a web browser through the HTTP Protocol. There’s a lot more one should learn about Internet Protocols, but it’s not required to get an operational understanding of working with websites. Web Design Principles The page that is rendered by the web browser is formatted in Hypertext Markup Language or HTML for short. HTML is a set of nested tags that describe how the page should be structured.

item.title: Web Development Intro
item.description: A website is rendered in a web browser through the HTTP Protocol. There’s a lot more one should learn about Internet Protocols, but it’s not required to get an operational understanding of working with websites. The page that is rendered by the webbrowser is formatted in Hypertext Markup Language or HTML for short. HTML is a set of nested tags that describe how the page should be structured. It’s like an outline with hierarchical layers or if you recall from data structures class, a tree.

item.title: Building on the web
item.description: Table of Contents Introduction Process from Idea to Product Concepts of Web Development Tools Introduction # This page focuses on the process, concepts, and tools for building any type of web site or web application. A website has a lot of overlapping functionality and technology as a web application, except it doesn’t focus on high volume of dynamism and user interactivity, which would require a database.

item.title: Data Flow Diagrams
item.description: Table of Contents What are Data Flow Diagrams (DFD)? Notations Rectangle (Entity) Circle (Process) Rounded rectangle (Data Store) Arrow (Data flow) Why are Diagrams useful? How do you draw a diagram? Software for drawing diagrams References What are Data Flow Diagrams (DFD)? # This is a diagram that maps out the flow of information for any system.

item.title: Including a README with your project
item.description: What is a README? # This is a file that is named README, that usually resides in the root of your project directory. This name comes from the command Read me. as in the situation of handing a project off to another developer and writing a memo to them that should be read first before the source code. In a way, it serves as an executive summary of your project.

item.title: Build Tools
item.description: Table of Contents What is a build tool? GNU Make Makefile Apache Maven Maven Project Maven Commands Creating a Maven project from Scratch Explaining the pom.xml configiguration file Project File structure Compile and Run Collaborating on a Maven project Choosing a Build tool Links What is a build tool?

item.title: Sharing Coding Projects
item.description: Table of Contents Project based thinking Programming as an activity Planning before you begin coding Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) Checklists Elements to include with your project repository 1. Project description 2. Source code with comments 3. Submit to the form before deadline Elements of Style and Presentation Other Enhancements References Project based thinking # Programmers are typically learning to write source code to build programs not just scripts.

item.title: File naming conventions
item.description: Table of Contents Introduction Motivations for naming files well Organizing your directory Common File extensions Common Directory Names Ignoring files with your VCS repository Introduction # In the day to day work of programming, one often finds that a large fraction of time is spent looking for certain files. One of the wise adages with managing an assortment of files is to provide an organization scheme to make it easier to find what you need again.
